recipe.ingredients: - chickpeas (rinsed and drained): 1 can (15 ounces) - avocado (diced): 1 large - cucumber (large): 2 - lemon juice: 2 tablespoons - red onion (finely chopped): 1/4 cup - cherry tomatoes (diced): 1/2 cup - garlic powder: 1/2 teaspoon - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Cucumber Cups: Slice each cucumber into 1-inch thick pieces. Using a melon baller or small spoon, hollow out the center of each cucumber slice, being careful not to puncture the bottom, creating cups. 2. Make Chickpea Avocado Mixture: In a medium bowl, mash the chickpeas and avocado together. Add lemon juice, red onion, cherry tomatoes, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Mix until well combined. 3. Fill Cucumber Cups: Spoon the chickpea avocado mixture into the hollowed-out cucumber slices. 4. Chill and Serve: Place the cucumber cups in the refrigerator to chill for about 30 minutes before serving.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 38g, Dietary Fiber: 13g, Sodium: 290mg, Saturated Fat: 2g, Total Fat: 15g, Protein: 9g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 4g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 377 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Chickpeas: 210 calories per can Avocado: 322 calories Cucumber: 16 calories each Lemon Juice: 8 calories for 2 tablespoons Red Onion: 37 calories for 1/4 cup Cherry Tomatoes: 16 calories per 1/2 cup Garlic Powder, Salt, Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 10
